is an island in the Yasawa Islands of
. The only resort on the island is Kuata Natural Resort run by local village people in Waya lailai. It is a very friendly and happy resort  who welcome guests with Fijian style and beautiful smiles.
Travel on Yasawa Flyer from Denarau Marina. It takes about 2 hours. A small resort boat will come collect you off the Flyer.
Walking is the only method you would use in this island.

Beautiful ocean view all around! Beautiful coral and coulourful fish are plentiful in the water right off the beach. There are two beaches on the island.
The island has more colourful sea shells lying on the beach. It has a friendly sharks to feed in the beautiful oceans where the guys will take a trip to see those friendly sharks. Some of the fijian bures are still remaining which reminds us about the fijians traditions and culture. The "kava" ceremonies are still ongoing where the "kava" are the most precious wine to the fijians.The island has two long white sandy beaches where you can relax yourself by walking barefoot, no need to wear your sandals or your sneakers. The Fijians people are so friendly especially the staff and the Manager and they have a great hospitality.

The resort offers regular activity such as a trip to the outer reef for reef snorkeling (swim with reef sharks), village visit, sunset fishing, summit walk, Kava ceremony etc. The ladies from other villages come and sell craft items and happy to spend time teaching you how to make a weaving bracelet. Kayaking and summit walk to Waya lailai is also available on request. Beach volleyball net is set up on the beach for your use. Swim, relaxing on the beach, sleep on a hammock, mix with locals and other holiday makers... Professional massage by the beach is also available!

The water right off the beach is a snorkeling paradise. Bring your own gear or hire a set from the resort. Diving trips can be arranged for certified divers.

The resort offers three meals a day and this is included in the price you pay. 3.30pm is a coffee time also. Meal is a set meal each time with a variety of food offered each day. Plenty of fresh fruits and vegetable!
Water, soft drinks, beer and mixed spirits are available at the bar.The resort have taps where water are drinkable,and also it has so many palm trees where coconuts are available.
A small resort boat will take you back to Yasawa Flyer. Connection time to Yasawa Flyer is - traveling north 10.30am. traveling south 3.45pm. Daily service.

Dorm with shared facility and Bure (sleeps 2-4) are available.

Booking can be made through Awesome adventures or directly to the resort.
Awesome adventures 675 0499
